content.question: A <math alttext="50 microfarads" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>μ</mtext><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> capacitor is fully charged to <math alttext="40 microcoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>μ</mtext><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and then connected in series to a <math alttext="20 millihenrys" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>mH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> inductor and an open switch. After the switch is closed, what is the maximum current through the inductor?

choices.label: <math alttext="63.2 nanoamperes" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>63.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.0 microamperes" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>μ</mi><mi>A</mi></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 13.6: Circuits with Capacitors and Inductors (LC Circuits)

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
